key_risks: Declining print revenue and slow digital subscription growth
High debt levels and limited financial flexibility
Dependence on advertising revenue, particularly from SMBs
controversies: Journalistic independence concerns due to policy changes
Reverse discrimination lawsuit (dismissed but poses reputational risk)
social_issues: Layoffs and workforce reductions leading to strained employee relations
Unionized journalists staging walkouts and strikes
governance_issues: Financial mismanagement and excessive cost-cutting measures
Potential reputational risks from ethical and legal controversies

sources.title: Gannett's gag order on local journalism | The Free Speech Center
sources.snippet: When Jeff Bezos, billionaire owner of The Washington Post, suddenly ordered the newspaper not to endorse a presidential candidate, more than 250,000 readers rebelled and canceled their subscriptions. It was a stunning move by Bezos, but pales in scope compared to the Gannett Co.'s prohibition of presidential endorsements in its more than 200 newspapers and news outlets.

queries.query: Gannett Co Inc debt levels and financial stability
